children.Title: Policies for information security
children.Control: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be de-fined, approved by management, published, communicated to andacknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties,and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.
children.name: 5.1 Policies for information security

children.Title: Information security roles and responsibilities
children.Control: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined andallocated according to the organization needs.
children.name: 5.2 Information security roles and responsibilities

children.Title: Segregation of duties
children.Control: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be seg-regated.
children.name: 5.3 Segregation of duties

children.Title: Management responsibilities
children.Control: Management shall require all personnel to apply information securityin accordance with the established information security policy, top-ic-specific policies and procedures of the organization.
children.name: 5.4 Management responsibilities

children.Title: Contact with authorities
children.Control: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with relevantauthorities.
children.name: 5.5 Contact with authorities

children.Title: Contact with special interest groups
children.Control: The organization shall establish and maintain contact with specialinterest groups or other specialist security forums and professionalassociations.
children.name: 5.6 Contact with special interest groups

children.Title: Threat intelligence
children.Control: Information relating to information security threats shall be collectedand analysed to produce threat intelligence.
children.name: 5.7 Threat intelligence

children.Title: Information security in project management
children.Control: Information security shall be integrated into project management.
children.name: 5.8 Information security in project management

children.Title: Inventory of information and other associated assets
children.Control: An inventory of information and other associated assets, includingowners, shall be developed and maintained.
children.name: 5.9 Inventory of information and other associated assets

children.Title: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
children.Control: Rules for the acceptable use and procedures for handling information andother associated assets shall be identified, documented and implemented.
children.name: 5.10 Acceptable use of information and other associated assets

children.Title: Return of assets
children.Control: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate shall return allthe organization’s assets in their possession upon change or terminationof their employment, contract or agreement.
children.name: 5.11 Return of assets

children.Title: Classification of information
children.Control: Information shall be classified according to the information securityneeds of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availabilityand relevant interested party requirements.
children.name: 5.12 Classification of information

children.Title: Labelling of information
children.Control: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling shall bedeveloped and implemented in accordance with the information clas-sification scheme adopted by the organization.
children.name: 5.13 Labelling of information

children.Title: Information transfer
children.Control: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements shall be in placefor all types of transfer facilities within the organization and betweenthe organization and other parties.
children.name: 5.14 Information transfer

children.Title: Access control
children.Control: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and otherassociated assets shall be established and implemented based on busi-ness and information security requirements.
children.name: 5.15 Access control

children.Title: Identity management
children.Control: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.
children.name: 5.16 Identity management

children.Title: Authentication information
children.Control: Allocation and management of authentication information shall becontrolled by a management process, including advising personnel onappropriate handling of authentication information.
children.name: 5.17 Authentication information

children.Title: Access rights
children.Control: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall beprovisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with theorganization’s topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.
children.name: 5.18 Access rights

children.Title: Information security in supplier relationships
children.Control: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to managethe information security risks associated with the use of supplier’sproducts or services.
children.name: 5.19 Information security in supplier relationships

children.Title: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
children.Control: Relevant information security requirements shall be established andagreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.
children.name: 5.20 Addressing information security within supplier agreements

children.Title: Managing information security in the information and communication technology (ICT) supply chain
children.Control: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to managethe information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.
children.name: 5.21 Managing information security in the information and communication technology (ICT) supply chain

children.Title: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
children.Control: The organization shall regularly monitor, review, evaluate and managechange in supplier information security practices and service delivery.
children.name: 5.22 Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services

children.Title: Information security for use of cloud services
children.Control: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud servicesshall be established in accordance with the organization’s informationsecurity requirements.
children.name: 5.23 Information security for use of cloud services

children.Title: Information security incident management planning and preparation
children.Control: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating informationsecurity incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.
children.name: 5.24 Information security incident management planning and preparation

children.Title: Assessment and decision on information security events
children.Control: The organization shall assess information security events and decide ifthey are to be categorized as information security incidents.
children.name: 5.25 Assessment and decision on information security events

children.Title: Response to information security incidents
children.Control: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance withthe documented procedures.
children.name: 5.26 Response to information security incidents

children.Title: Learning from information security incidents
children.Control: Knowledge gained from information security incidents shall be used tostrengthen and improve the information security controls.
children.name: 5.27 Learning from information security incidents

children.Title: Collection of evidence
children.Control: The organization shall establish and implement procedures for the iden-tification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence relatedto information security events.
children.name: 5.28 Collection of evidence

children.Title: Information security during disruption
children.Control: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at anappropriate level during disruption.
children.name: 5.29 Information security during disruption

children.Title: ICT readiness for business continuity
children.Control: ICT readiness shall be planned, implemented, maintained and testedbased on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.
children.name: 5.30 ICT readiness for business continuity

children.Title: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
children.Control: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant toinformation security and the organization’s approach to meet theserequirements shall be identified, documented and kept up to date.
children.name: 5.31 Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements

children.Title: Intellectual property rights
children.Control: The organization shall implement appropriate procedures to protectintellectual property rights.
children.name: 5.32 Intellectual property rights

children.Title: Protection of records
children.Control: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unau-thorized access and unauthorized release.
children.name: 5.33 Protection of records

children.Title: Privacy and protection of person al identifiable information (PII)
children.Control: The organization shall identify and meet the requirements regardingthe preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicablelaws and regulations and contractual requirements.
children.name: 5.34 Privacy and protection of person al identifiable information (PII)

children.Title: Independent review of information security
children.Control: The organization’s approach to managing information security andits implementation including people, processes and technologies shallbe reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significantchanges occur.
children.name: 5.35 Independent review of information security

children.Title:
Compliance with policies, rules Control
and standards for information security
children.Control: Compliance with the organization’s information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards shall be regularly reviewed.
children.name:
5.36 Compliance with policies, rules Control
and standards for information security

children.Title: Documented operating procedures
children.Control: Operating procedures for information processing facilities shall bedocumented and made available to personnel who need them.
children.name: 5.37 Documented operating procedures

children.Title: Screening
children.Control: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnelshall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoingbasis taking into consideration applicable laws, regulations and ethicsand be proportional to the business requirements, the classification ofthe information to be accessed and the perceived risks.
children.name: 6.1 Screening

children.Title: Terms and conditions of employment
children.Control: The employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel’s andthe organization’s responsibilities for information security.
children.name: 6.2 Terms and conditions of employment

children.Title: nformation security awareness, education and training
children.Control: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receiveappropriate information security awareness, education and trainingand regular updates of the organization's information security policy,topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.
children.name: 6.3 nformation security awareness, education and training

children.Title: Disciplinary process
children.Control: A disciplinary process shall be formalized and communicated to takeactions against personnel and other relevant interested parties whohave committed an information security policy violation.
children.name: 6.4 Disciplinary process

children.Title: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
children.Control: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid aftertermination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced andcommunicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties
children.name: 6.5 Responsibilities after termination or change of employment

children.Title: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
children.Control: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organ-ization’s needs for the protection of information shall be identified,documented, regularly reviewed and signed by personnel and otherrelevant interested parties.
children.name: 6.6 Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements

children.Title: Remote working
children.Control: Security measures shall be implemented when personnel are workingremotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outsidethe organization’s premises.
children.name: 6.7 Remote working

children.Title: Information security event porting
children.Control: The organization shall provide a mechanism for personnel to reportobserved or suspected information security events through appropriatechannels in a timely manner.
children.name: 6.8 Information security event porting

children.Title: Physical security perimeters
children.Control: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas thatcontain information and other associated assets.
children.name: 7.1 Physical security perimeters

children.Title: Physical entry
children.Control: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls andaccess points.
children.name: 7.2 Physical entry

children.Title: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
children.Control: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed andimplemented.
children.name: 7.3 Securing offices, rooms and facilities

children.Title: Physical security monitoring
children.Control: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physicalaccess.
children.name: 7.4 Physical security monitoring

children.Title: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
children.Control: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as naturaldisasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats toinfrastructure shall be designed and implemented.
children.name: 7.5 Protecting against physical and environmental threats

children.Title: Working in secure areas
children.Control: Security measures for working in secure areas shall be designed andimplemented.
children.name: 7.6 Working in secure areas

children.Title: Clear desk and clear screen
children.Control: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clearscreen rules for information processing facilities shall be defined andappropriately enforced.
children.name: 7.7 Clear desk and clear screen

children.Title: Equipment siting and protection
children.Control: Equipment shall be sited securely and protected.
children.name: 7.8 Equipment siting and protection

children.Title: Security of assets off-premises
children.Control: Off-site assets shall be protected.
children.name: 7.9 Security of assets off-premises

children.Title: Storage media
children.Control: Storage media shall be managed through their life cycle of acquisition,use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organization’sclassification scheme and handling requirements.
children.name: 7.10 Storage media

children.Title: Supporting utilities
children.Control: Information processing facilities shall be protected from power failuresand other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.
children.name: 7.11 Supporting utilities

children.Title: Cabling security
children.Control: Cables carrying power, data or supporting information services shallbe protected from interception, interference or damage.
children.name: 7.12 Cabling security

children.Title: Equipment maintenance
children.Control: Equipment shall be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrityand confidentiality of information.
children.name: 7.13 Equipment maintenance

children.Title: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
children.Control: Items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to en-sure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removedor securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.
children.name: 7.14 Secure disposal or re-use of equipment

children.Title: User end point devices
children.Control: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user end pointdevices shall be protected.
children.name: 8.1 User end point devices

children.Title: Privileged access rights
children.Control: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restrictedand managed.
children.name: 8.2 Privileged access rights

children.Title: Information access restriction
children.Control: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted inaccordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.
children.name: 8.3 Information access restriction

children.Title: Access to source code
children.Control: Read and write access to source code, development tools and softwarelibraries shall be appropriately managed.
children.name: 8.4 Access to source code

children.Title: Secure authentication
children.Control: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be implementedbased on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policyon access control.
children.name: 8.5 Secure authentication

children.Title: Capacity management
children.Control: The use of resources shall be monitored and adjusted in line with currentand expected capacity requirements.
children.name: 8.6 Capacity management

children.Title: Protection against malware
children.Control: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported byappropriate user awareness.
children.name: 8.7 Protection against malware

children.Title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
children.Control: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems inuse shall be obtained, the organization’s exposure to such vulnerabilitiesshall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.
children.name: 8.8 Management of technical vulnerabilities

children.Title: Configuration management
children.Control: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software,services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented,monitored and reviewed.
children.name: 8.9 Configuration management

children.Title: Information deletion
children.Control: Information stored in information systems, devices or in any otherstorage media shall be deleted when no longer required.
children.name: 8.10 Information deletion

children.Title: Data masking
children.Control: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization’stopic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specificpolicies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation intoconsideration.
children.name: 8.11 Data masking

children.Title: Data leakage prevention
children.Control: Data leakage prevention measures shall be applied to systems, net-works and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitiveinformation.
children.name: 8.12 Data leakage prevention

children.Title: Information backup
children.Control: Backup copies of information, software and systems shall be maintainedand regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policyon backup.
children.name: 8.13 Information backup

children.Title: Redundancy of information processing facilities
children.Control: Information processing facilities shall be implemented with redundancysufficient to meet availability requirements.
children.name: 8.14 Redundancy of information processing facilities

children.Title: Logging
children.Control: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant eventsshall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.
children.name: 8.15 Logging

children.Title: Monitoring activities
children.Control: Networks, systems and applications shall be monitored for anomalousbehaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential infor-mation security incidents.
children.name: 8.16 Monitoring activities

children.Title: Clock synchronization
children.Control: The clocks of information processing systems used by the organizationshall be synchronized to approved time sources.
children.name: 8.17 Clock synchronization

children.Title: Use of privileged utility programs
children.Control: The use of utility programs that can be capable of overriding systemand application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.
children.name: 8.18 Use of privileged utility programs

children.Title: Installation of software on operational systems
children.Control: Procedures and measures shall be implemented to securely managesoftware installation on operational systems.
children.name: 8.19 Installation of software on operational systems

children.Title: Networks security
children.Control: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlledto protect information in systems and applications.
children.name: 8.20 Networks security

children.Title: Security of network services
children.Control: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of networkservices shall be identified, implemented and monitored.
children.name: 8.21 Security of network services

children.Title: Segregation of networks
children.Control: Groups of information services, users and information systems shallbe segregated in the organization’s networks.
children.name: 8.22 Segregation of networks

children.Title: Web filtering
children.Control: Access to external websites shall be managed to reduce exposure tomalicious content.
children.name: 8.23 Web filtering

children.Title: Use of cryptography
children.Control: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic keymanagement, shall be defined and implemented.
children.name: 8.24 Use of cryptography

children.Title: Secure development life cycle
children.Control: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall beestablished and applied.
children.name: 8.25 Secure development life cycle

children.Title: Application security requirements
children.Control: Information security requirements shall be identified, specified andapproved when developing or acquiring applications.
children.name: 8.26 Application security requirements

children.Title: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
children.Control: Principles for engineering secure systems shall be established, docu-mented, maintained and applied to any information system developmentactivities.
children.name: 8.27 Secure system architecture and engineering principles

children.Title: Secure coding
children.Control: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.
children.name: 8.28 Secure coding

children.Title: Security testing in development and acceptance
children.Control: Security testing processes shall be defined and implemented in thedevelopment life cycle.
children.name: 8.29 Security testing in development and acceptance

children.Title: Outsourced development
children.Control: The organization shall direct, monitor and review the activities relatedto outsourced system development.
children.name: 8.30 Outsourced development

children.Title: Separation of development, test and production environments
children.Control: Development, testing and production environments shall be separatedand secured.
children.name: 8.31 Separation of development, test and production environments

children.Title: Change management
children.Control: Changes to information processing facilities and information systemsshall be subject to change management procedures.
children.name: 8.32 Change management

children.Title: Test information
children.Control: Test information shall be appropriately selected, protected and managed.
children.name: 8.33 Test information

children.Title: Protection of information systems during audit testing
children.Control: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of op-erational systems shall be planned and agreed between the tester andappropriate management.
children.name: 8.34 Protection of information systems during audit testing
